titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I finished the 'sermon' for New Year's Day, and caused 3 copies to be prepared for the Press. In the afternoon I walked round the Park with Lionel. The snow is frozen, & crackles under the foot.
Some kind person thinks it worth while to send me a type written communication to the following effect
and an early repentance for your
This is but one of many tokens of the squalid fanaticism which is running loose in the nation.

sends me an ecstatically worded telegram in answer to my proposal of a small book on the crisis to be called 'Thinking Aloud: Reflections on the Crisis'. He seems to suppose that I would, and could, produce a volume of rhodomontade like Dick Shepperd's 'prophecy'. What have I said or done to deserve this?
